DataElement.preferredName: Molecular Trial Screening Consent Clinical Questionnaire Complete Occurrence Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a patient who has completed a clinical questionnaire is proceeding with the molecular prescreening consent process.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Molecular Trial Screening Consent Clinical Questionnaire Complete Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Molecular; relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules._Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services._Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.A systematic examination or assessment._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A predetermined set of questions._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.:A process of active consideration of potential subjects for enrollment in a trial.:Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.
A process of active consideration of potential subjects for enrollment in a trial.
Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
